Data#

bert_squeeze.data.local_datasets#

class bert_squeeze.data.local_datasets.conference_dataset.ConferenceDataset(*args, writer_batch_size=None, **kwargs)[source]#

Conference dataset

Constructs a DatasetBuilder.

Callers must pass arguments as keyword arguments.

Parameters:

  • cache_dir – str, directory to read/write data. Defaults to “~/datasets”.

  • name – str name, optional configuration for the dataset that affects the data generated on disk. Different `builder_config`s will have their own subdirectories and versions. If not provided, uses the first configuration in self.BUILDER_CONFIGS

  • hash – a hash specific to the dataset code. Used to update the caching directory when the dataset loading script code is updated (to avoid reusing old data). The typical caching directory (defined in self._relative_data_dir) is: name/version/hash/

  • base_path – str, base path for relative paths that are used to download files. This can be a remote url.

  • features – Features, optional features that will be used to read/write the dataset It can be used to changed the datasets.Features description of a dataset for example.

  • use_auth_token (str or bool, optional) – Optional string or boolean to use as Bearer token for remote files on the Datasets Hub. If True, will get token from "~/.huggingface".

  • namespace – str, used to separate builders with the same name but not coming from the same namespace. For example to separate “squad” from “lhoestq/squad” (the builder name would be “lhoestq___squad”).

  • data_files – for builders like “csv” or “json” that need the user to specify data files. They can be either local or remote files. For convenience you can use a DataFilesDict.

  • data_dir – str, for builders that require manual download. It must be the path to the local directory containing the manually downloaded data.

  • config_kwargs – will override the defaults kwargs in config

BUILDER_CONFIG_CLASS#

alias of ConferenceConfig

class bert_squeeze.data.local_datasets.parallel_dataset.ParallelDataset(*args, writer_batch_size=None, **kwargs)[source]#

Dataset for parallel distillation

Constructs a DatasetBuilder.

Callers must pass arguments as keyword arguments.

Parameters:

  • cache_dir – str, directory to read/write data. Defaults to “~/datasets”.

  • name – str name, optional configuration for the dataset that affects the data generated on disk. Different `builder_config`s will have their own subdirectories and versions. If not provided, uses the first configuration in self.BUILDER_CONFIGS

  • hash – a hash specific to the dataset code. Used to update the caching directory when the dataset loading script code is updated (to avoid reusing old data). The typical caching directory (defined in self._relative_data_dir) is: name/version/hash/

  • base_path – str, base path for relative paths that are used to download files. This can be a remote url.

  • features – Features, optional features that will be used to read/write the dataset It can be used to changed the datasets.Features description of a dataset for example.

  • use_auth_token (str or bool, optional) – Optional string or boolean to use as Bearer token for remote files on the Datasets Hub. If True, will get token from "~/.huggingface".

  • namespace – str, used to separate builders with the same name but not coming from the same namespace. For example to separate “squad” from “lhoestq/squad” (the builder name would be “lhoestq___squad”).

  • data_files – for builders like “csv” or “json” that need the user to specify data files. They can be either local or remote files. For convenience you can use a DataFilesDict.

  • data_dir – str, for builders that require manual download. It must be the path to the local directory containing the manually downloaded data.

  • config_kwargs – will override the defaults kwargs in config

class bert_squeeze.data.local_datasets.unlabeled_dataset.DatasetUnlabeled(*args, writer_batch_size=None, **kwargs)[source]#

Dataset to use for soft distillation.

Constructs a DatasetBuilder.

Callers must pass arguments as keyword arguments.

Parameters:

  • cache_dir – str, directory to read/write data. Defaults to “~/datasets”.

  • name – str name, optional configuration for the dataset that affects the data generated on disk. Different `builder_config`s will have their own subdirectories and versions. If not provided, uses the first configuration in self.BUILDER_CONFIGS

  • hash – a hash specific to the dataset code. Used to update the caching directory when the dataset loading script code is updated (to avoid reusing old data). The typical caching directory (defined in self._relative_data_dir) is: name/version/hash/

  • base_path – str, base path for relative paths that are used to download files. This can be a remote url.

  • features – Features, optional features that will be used to read/write the dataset It can be used to changed the datasets.Features description of a dataset for example.

  • use_auth_token (str or bool, optional) – Optional string or boolean to use as Bearer token for remote files on the Datasets Hub. If True, will get token from "~/.huggingface".

  • namespace – str, used to separate builders with the same name but not coming from the same namespace. For example to separate “squad” from “lhoestq/squad” (the builder name would be “lhoestq___squad”).

  • data_files – for builders like “csv” or “json” that need the user to specify data files. They can be either local or remote files. For convenience you can use a DataFilesDict.

  • data_dir – str, for builders that require manual download. It must be the path to the local directory containing the manually downloaded data.

  • config_kwargs – will override the defaults kwargs in config

bert_squeeze.data.modules#

class bert_squeeze.data.modules.distillation_module.DistillationDataModule(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)[source]#

LightningDataModule for Distillation procedures.

The module stitches together the teacher and student DataModules as they might require different processing steps depending on the models used.

The module features two extra options: - It can generate extra labeled samples by using an HardLabeler. - It accepts an additional dataset that will be softly labeled by the

teacher and used to further distil its knowledge.

Parameters:

  • teacher_module (TeacherDataModule) – LightningDataModule to use for the teacher model.

  • student_module (StudentDataModule) – LightningDataModule to use for the student model.

  • soft_data_config (DictConfig) – Configuration to use for the “soft” dataset.

  • hard_labeler (HardLabeler) – Instance of HardLabeler to use to generate hardly labeled samples.

featurize() → DatasetDict[source]#

Method to featurize both teacher and student data and to concatenate them into one dataset.

Returns:

concatenated dataset ready to be used for distillation

Return type:

datasets.DatasetDict

get_soft_dataset() → Dataset[source]#

Loads and adds a “fake label” to the dataset that will later be used for soft distillation.

Returns:

dataset used for soft distillation

Return type:

datasets.DatasetDict

prepare_data() → None[source]#

Load teacher and student datasets

class bert_squeeze.data.modules.lr_module.LrDataModule(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)[source]#

DataModule for Logistic Regression which can be seen as a bag of n-grams.

Parameters:

  • dataset_config (HydraConfig) – dataset configuration

  • max_features (int) – Number of maximum features to use. This will be used to build a vocabulary of max_features words.

featurize() → DatasetDict[source]#
Returns:

featurized dataset

Return type:

DatasetDict

load_dataset() → None[source]#

Load dataset

class bert_squeeze.data.modules.lstm_module.LSTMDataModule(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)[source]#

DataModule for LSTM models

Parameters:

  • dataset_config (HydraConfig) – dataset configuration

  • max_features (int) – Number of maximum words to use to build a vocabulary.

clean_str(example: Dict[str, Any]) → Dict[str, Any][source]#

Utility method to properly format the self.text_col of an example and avoid OOV tokens.

Parameters:

example (Dict[str, Any]) – sample for which to format the self.text_col column

Returns:

example with re-formatted text

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

featurize() → DatasetDict[source]#
Returns:

featurized dataset

Return type:

DatasetDict

tokens_to_ids(example: Dict[str, Any]) → Dict[str, Any][source]#

Utility method to tokenize the self.text_col. It will add a “features” key to example which contains a List[int] corresponding to the vocabulary ids of each token.

Parameters:

example (Dict[str, Any]) – sample for which to tokenize self.text_col

Returns:

featurized example

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

class bert_squeeze.data.modules.transformer_module.TransformerDataModule(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any)[source]#

DataModule for Transformer-based models.

Parameters:

  • dataset_config (HydraConfig) – dataset configuration

  • tokenizer_name (str) – name of the pre-trained tokenizer to use

  • max_length (int) – maximum sequence length of the inputs to the tokenizer
